channel.title: what I do on Mathematical Michael
channel.description: Recent content in what I do on Mathematical Michael

item.title: art
item.description: Probably Art I combine art, math, and machines to build wonderful things. Start with today. Show biggest achievement. How did we get here? Probability-Dependent Generative Artwork. It was the first experience I had with GUIs, and then the same theme tied together this project. Real-time visualization of randomness, now used to aid in design. I want to find more projects like this. Description Describe your relationship to art.

item.title: estimation
item.description: Research MUD The Oracle (AKA the Monte-Carlo Calculator) talk about research, wanting to make something useful, something to share. The Oracle is a web app I built to help me make quick estimates without keeping them in my head (and then share them!). Often we find “back-of-the-napkin” calculations to be useful… randall munroe what if … fermi problems wiki … TK TK TK It is deployed with #kubernetes on #google-cloud-platform and is built with #python using #flask.

item.title: architect & engineer
item.description: Software Contributions I learned so much from free software and feel the need to contribute back. When I do things now, I make them available so that people can learn from my trials and tribulations. I believe in making complicated things easier for people to digest, and software contributions is one way I do it. ML Starter-Packs ml-starter-packs is a Github organization I created to house relatively polished projects for public consumption.

item.title: etc
item.description: More Projects Consider this a dumping ground for links to things I want to show people I’ve done. Academic Research I worked to develop new ways of quantifying and reducing uncertainty.
